title: IDOR  [mtnmobad.mtnbusiness.com.ng]
content:
Steps To Reproduce:
Go to https://mtnmobad.mtnbusiness.com.ng/#/dashboard/home with burp proxy
Intercept a POST request to /app/dashboardData and review its response you will see emails and ids
Go to https://mtnmobad.mtnbusiness.com.ng/#/userProfile
change name, mobile, address etc. and intercept with burp proxy
change the id and the email with victim's and forward the request
The changes will be saved in the victim's account
Note:
If you already know account's email and id you can skip step 1 and 2
Supporting Material/References:
Impact
An attacker can change every user's account information
steps: Intercept a POST request to /app/dashboardData and review its response you will see emails and ids
Change name, mobile, address etc. and intercept with burp proxy
Change the id and the email with victim's and forward the request
The changes will be saved in the victim's account
vuln_description: This is an Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR) vulnerability that allows an attacker to modify any user's account information by intercepting and manipulating requests to the application's backend. The attacker can change sensitive details like name, mobile, address, etc., by simply altering the user ID and email in the intercepted request.
reason: The vulnerability involves straightforward steps of intercepting and modifying requests, which is a common technique in security testing. The attack does not require understanding complex application states or novel logic, and the interaction between components is obvious once the initial request interception is performed.
